Thermal equilibrium is not really existent temperature is basically the measurement of vibration of molecules and atoms. You could look at two different object colliding asSo when cold
(which is the slower vibration of molecules) meets hot (which is the quicker vibration of molecules) meet they collide which causes energy transfer. So when they transfer energy they either cause the other molecules to slow down or speed up. When an object is in a room it reaches room temperature eventually because there are more molecules of air that have the same temperature that cause the object to be hit with the same energy until it’s at room temperature
